After playing this game for a few hours there is two different components to this game. Tour of Duty (TOD) and Deleted Scenes (DS). I got this game in the Valve bundle pack and decided to give them a shot because they were just sitting in my library. 

[b]Tour of Duty:[/b]
This game is absolutely horrible! I'm not a great CS player by any means but I'm no stranger to the FPS genre so I decided to play it on hard. It's rather frustrating from the beginning as you're allotted points to assemble your unit with attributes such as skill, co-op and bravery which rank by a strength ratings bad, low, ok, good and high. As expected playing against bots your team is pretty much garbage while the A.I tracks you and kills you like a rabid dog while going against another A.I it's like watching Stevie Ray and Ray Charles having a gun fight. It seems that if you use commands the A.I responds to them. However, being that most of us use mics online I never bothered to learn CS commands. 

Missions requiring you to save hostages can be frustrating as your team A.I will seem to deliberately get good at finishing the round before you can save them. If you rescue them one or two at a time it appears to go over better than collecting all 4 in one go. On that note, the  requirements to pass a level are rather tedious. kill x amount of enemies, kill x enemies with [weapon] Finish round in x amount of time. I guess for the time this game was released it would have served as training but being that most people probably play GO the TOD didn't hold up to the test of time.

Apparently, there are some fun Zombie mods in this game and might be a selling point to you but that aside this game isn't worth getting.

[b]Deleted Scenes:[/b]

I actually had quite a bit of fun playing the DS. It's a linear CS story game where the story didn't make a any sense really just that you go and do a bunch of salvage, rescue missions. On the highest difficulty it's still pretty easy (funny how I complained about bs aim bots for TOR) The best way to describe it, is that it's a CS half-life game. With Puzzles, linear paths, and stuff you expect from half-life games. Is it worth buying? I wouldn't waste money on it alone but if you're going to buy the valve bundle pack it's a fun linear fps game.

Counter strike condition zero is a multiplayer optional tatical fps, so everyone knows the first real esport title, at least the first so well know by everyone, I know quake 1 and rts games was also esport games well know, but counter strike did more, moba somehow got some of the mmo fans, but the game still around, and I still like it a lot, most of it because its playable in single player, I hate the multiplayer part of this game entirely, there is a lot of coop gameplay to it, but I'm not talking about the sequel here, "counter strike go" have deathmach mode, and its all that matters to me in a mmo fps, this one in other hand only have the "bomb mode" where both teams have a goal, mixed with "last man standing" mode, I don't like that because you get stuck without gameplay for 10 minutes or more, but since this game have a single player mode, you can restart the match any time without many problems, loading times don't take much long, and in my opinion the graphics still holds up very well, biggest problem with this game is the sniper reloading animation using the quick scope technique, that being manually making the reload pressing twice the "Q" button, it doesn't looks good like in "counter strike go" it looks much much better in "counter strike go", definitively my second favorite counter strike game, and it could be my favorite counter strike if it had "free for all" or "deathmach" modes in it, but it doesn't, so second favorite counter strike game.

+many weapons to choose
+single player mode included
+cool main menu
